intro: Micromeria juliana var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and has small, narrow leaves with a distinctive aromatic scent. Its flowers are white or pale yellow and are clustered in umbels, contributing to its ornamental value. This variety is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
